place.name: BUTLERS MARSTON
place.gazetteerText: BUTLERS-MARSTON, a parish in Shipston-on-Stour district, Warwick; on an affluent of the river Avon, 1½ mile SW of Kineton, and 7½ W by S of Fenny-Compton r. station. Post Town, Kineton, under Warwick. Acres, 1,620. Real property, £2,630. Pop., 271. Houses, 63. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £169. Patron, Christ Church, Oxford. The church is Norman. There is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
